class.name: ConfigFile
class.brief_description: Helper class to handle INI-style files.
class.description: This helper class can be used to store [Variant] values on the filesystem using INI-style formatting. The stored values are indentified by a section and a key: [codeblock] [section] some_key=42 string_example="Hello World!" a_vector=Vector3( 1, 0, 2 ) [/codeblock] The stored data can be saved to or parsed from a file, though ConfigFile objects can also be used directly without accessing the filesystem. The following example shows how to parse an INI-style file from the system, read its contents and store new values in it: [codeblock] var config = ConfigFile.new() var err = config.load("user://settings.cfg") if err == OK: # if not, something went wrong with the file loading # Look for the display/width pair, and default to 1024 if missing var screen_width = get_value("display", "width", 1024) # Store a variable if and only if it hasn't been defined yet if not config.has_section_key("audio", "mute"): config.set_value("audio", "mute", false) # Save the changes by overwriting the previous file config.save("user://settings.cfg") [/codeblock]

method.name: erase_section
method.description: Deletes the specified section along with all the key-value pairs inside.

method.name: get_section_keys
method.description: Returns an array of all defined key identifiers in the specified section.

method.name: get_sections
method.description: Returns an array of all defined section identifiers.

method.name: get_value
method.description: Returns the current value for the specified section and key. If the section and/or the key do not exist, the method returns the value of the optional [code]default[/code] argument, or [code]null[/code] if it is omitted.

method.name: has_section
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the specified section exists.

method.name: has_section_key
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the specified section-key pair exists.

method.name: load
method.description: Loads the config file specified as a parameter. The file's contents are parsed and loaded in the ConfigFile object which the method was called on. Returns one of the [code]OK[/code], [code]FAILED[/code] or [code]ERR_*[/code] constants listed in [@Global Scope]. If the load was successful, the return value is [code]OK[/code].

method.name: save
method.description: Saves the contents of the ConfigFile object to the file specified as a parameter. The output file uses an INI-style structure. Returns one of the [code]OK[/code], [code]FAILED[/code] or [code]ERR_*[/code] constants listed in [@Global Scope]. If the load was successful, the return value is [code]OK[/code].

method.name: set_value
method.description: Assigns a value to the specified key of the the specified section. If the section and/or the key do not exist, they are created. Passing a [code]null[/code] value deletes the specified key if it exists, and deletes the section if it ends up empty once the key has been removed.
